Sentence: Dixon escapes to the pub and returns to the Welches' later that night, where he (Dixon) makes a drunken pass at Margaret Peel, a friend and colleague
Dixon and Margaret's friendship has rapidly been moving toward something more intimate, thanks to Margaret's subtle pressure and Dixon's pity and good-natured concern for Margaret
Margaret kicks Dixon out of her (Margaret) room, and he (Dixon) falls asleep while smoking a cigarette
The same day, Dixon meets with Catchpole, the man who supposedly inspired Margaret's suicide attempt
Catchpole reveals that Margaret faked the suicide attempt in order to gain sympathy from Dixon and Catchpole
Dixon tells Christine that he (Dixon) is through with Margaret
